item.title: Azure Data Factory - Self Hosted Integration Runtime on Windows Container
item.description: If you are looking for how to get started with Azure Data Factory (ADF), I will definitely recommend you to go through Cathrine Wilhelmsen’s – Beginnerâ€™s Guide to Azure Data Factory. It helped me to understand the basics for ADF before starting work on a project I recently had a chance to participate at my workplace. The compute infrastructure that is required by ADF provides the following data integration capabilities across different network environment:

item.title: Migrating from AWS to Azure
item.description: Last week Docker released its first Github Action called docker/build-push-action . This has been developed by Docker after keeping into consideration to simplify basic workflow of: building an image, tagging it, logging into Docker Hub, and pushing the image to a registry. My previous blog Docker images on Github Package Registry showcased how we could achieve the above workflow with Github package registry. If you look at the workflow definition dockerimage.
